[[Image:G.H. Cowling.png|thumb|''Professor George Herbert Cowling'']]
'''George Herbert Cowling''' ([[1881]]- [[23 July]] [[1946]]) was a British philologist and friend of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].<ref name=Bay/>
==Biography==
In [[1920]] Cowling was lecturing at the [[University of Leeds]], as Assistant Lecturer in English Language under Tolkien and [[E.V. Gordon]].<ref name=Bay>Dr David Hansen, [http://bayeastauctions.com.au/lot_details.php?lot=177950 The Art & Book Sale 27 November 2011, Lot No. 389] at [http://bayeastauctions.com.au/ BayEastAuctions.com.au] (accessed 26 November 2011)</ref><ref name=CG/> In [[1925]], when Tolkien moved to the [[University of Oxford]], Cowling was appointed Reader.<ref name=CG>{{CG|RG}}, p. 502</ref> He subsequently moved to Australia to take up the Chair of English at the University of Melbourne in [[1928]]. The Tolkien and Cowling families remained friends; in [[1938]] they stayed with J.R.R. and [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]] at [[Oxford]] when on sabbatical leave.<ref name=Bay/>

His wife Muriel (Mollie) maintained contact with the Tolkien family after her husband's death, and visited the Tolkiens in [[Wikipedia:England|England]] on several occasions. During such a visit in [[1955]], Muriel was given signed copies of three volumes of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' (in which Tolkien included a [[Tengwar]] inscription).<ref name=Bay/>
